sentences.en: Billy Ewing grabbed him by the elbow and took him aside.
sentences.cn: 比利·尤因拉着他的胳膊肘把他带到了一边。

sentences.en: Elbow pads and knee pads are essential on a skateboard.
sentences.cn: 滑滑板时带护肘和护膝是必要的.

sentences.en: He had a patch on the elbow of his jacket.
sentences.cn: 他的上衣肘部有一块补丁.

sentences.en: He lay beside her awkwardly, propped on an elbow.
sentences.cn: 他用一只胳膊肘支着身体，别扭地躺在她旁边。

sentences.en: He slipped and fell, badly bruising an elbow.
sentences.cn: 他滑倒了，严重挫伤了一只胳膊肘。

sentences.en: His elbow poked out through his torn shirt sleeve.
sentences.cn: 他的胳膊从衬衫的破袖子中露了出来.

sentences.en: I placed his drink on the small table at his elbow.
sentences.cn: 我把他的饮料放在他肘边的小桌子上。

sentences.en: I tried to get her to give him the elbow.
sentences.cn: 我试图让她抛开他。

sentences.en: I was up to my elbows in the cheese-potato mixture.
sentences.cn: 我的手深陷在奶酪土豆泥里。

sentences.en: I've worn through the elbow of this old coat at last.
sentences.cn: 最后我把这件旧外套的肘部磨出了窟窿.

sentences.en: Martin eyed the bottle at Marianne's elbow.
sentences.cn: 马丁端详着玛丽安娜肘边的瓶子。

sentences.en: Non-state firms gradually elbow aside the inefficient state-owned ones.
sentences.cn: 非国有企业逐渐挤掉了效率低下的国有企业。

sentences.en: She broke free by thrusting her elbow into his chest.
sentences.cn: 她用肘猛击他的胸部，挣脱了出来。

sentences.en: she decided to give tradition the elbow.
sentences.cn: 她决定抛开传统。

sentences.en: She jabbed him with her elbow.
sentences.cn: 她用胳膊肘捅他。

sentences.en: She poked him in the ribs with her elbow.
sentences.cn: 她用胳膊肘顶他的肋部。

sentences.en: She pushed through the crowd, elbowing people out of the way.
sentences.cn: 她用手肘把人们推开，从人群中挤了出来。

sentences.en: She raised herself on one elbow.
sentences.cn: 她用一只胳膊肘撑起身体。

sentences.en: There was not much elbow room in the cockpit of a Snipe.
sentences.cn: “沙锥鸟”战斗机的驾驶舱空间不太宽敞。

sentences.en: When you are sitting, keep your elbow on the arm rest.
sentences.cn: 坐立时，把胳膊肘靠在扶手上。

phrases.tran_cn: (非正式)对…弃之不顾，抛开，排斥
肘部发炎；网球运动员常见的肘伤

trans.tran_en: the joint where your arm bends
to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them
to push someone with your elbows, especially in order to move past them
